import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
source.179a2452:
plt.figure(figsize=(10,10))
sns.histplot(data['births'],color='orange')
plt.title('Distribution of number of Births')
source.86f437b4:
plt.figure(figsize=(20,7))
plt.subplot(1,2,1)
sns.barplot(x = data['year'],y = data['births'],palette='Set2')
plt.title('Distribution of Birth with respect to Years ')

plt.subplot(1,2,2)
sns.lineplot(x = data['year'],y = data['births'])
plt.title('Lineplot of Births with respect to Years')
plt.show()
source.6b6d70ef:
data['month'] = data['month'].map({1:'jan',2:'feb',3:'mar',4:'apr',5:'may',6:'jun',7:'jul',8:'aug',9:'sep',10:'oct',11:'nov',12:'dec'})


plt.figure(figsize=(20,7))
plt.subplot(1,2,1)
sns.barplot(x = data['month'],y = data['births'],palette='Set2')
plt.title('Distribution of Births With Respect to  Months')

plt.subplot(1,2,2)
sns.lineplot(x = data['month'],y = data['births'])
plt.title('Lineplot of Births With Respect to  Months')
plt.show()
source.911b8c07:
plt.figure(figsize=(20,10))
plt.subplot(1,2,1)
plt.title('Distribution of Births With Respect to Days of Month')
sns.barplot(x = data['date_of_month'],y = data['births'])
plt.subplot(1,2,2)
plt.title('Lineplot of Births With Respect to Days of Month')
sns.lineplot(x = data['date_of_month'],y = data['births'])
plt.show()
source.e9a2d31b:
plt.figure(figsize=(20,10))
plt.subplot(1,2,1)
plt.title('Distribution of Births with respect to Days of Week')
sns.barplot(x = data['day_of_week'],y = data['births'],palette='Set2')
plt.subplot(1,2,2)
plt.title('lineplot of Births with respect to Days of Week')
sns.lineplot(x = data['day_of_week'],y = data['births'])
plt.show()
source.cfcbdd9d: ### We can observe that there is a slight increase in the number of births in month of August and September.
